titleStmt.title: Thomas M. Vincent to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12192

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents
msIdentifier.idno: Box 8, Folder Box 8, Folder 20th Ky. Inf. - Misc

body.p:
Adjutant General's Office,
Washington, July 20th, 1864.
To His Excellency,
The Governor of Kentucky.
Sir:

I have the honor to report, that the following named Officers of the Volunteer forces from the State of Kentucky have been discharged at the dates, and for the causes, set opposite their respective names, viz:
Resigned Hon. Colonel S. D. Bruce 20 Regt June 30 1864

I am Sir
Very respectfully
Your Obt Servant
Thomas M Vincent
Asst Adjt General

20
No 172
Washington City
Report.
Resignations
Recd A. G. O. Aug 3. 1864
